name: Mean annual catch for each stock
description: Mean catch per stock in tonnes reported locally in New Caledonia

name: sb_sbsmsy from formal stock assessments
description: The ratio of spawning biomass to the spawner biomass  required to deliver maximum sustainable yield.

name: Fisheries management effectiveness and opportunity
description:
The opportunity for artisanal and recreational fishing based on the quality of management of the small- scale fishing sector (Mora et al 2009).

Data sources:

- Mora, C., Myers, R.A., Coll, M., Libralato, S., Pitcher, T.J., Sumaila, R.U., Worm, B. (2009). **Management Effectiveness of the Worldï¿s Marine Fisheries**. _PLoS Biol_, 7(6), e1000131. [doi:10.1371/journal.pbio.1000131](http://dx.doi.org/10.1371/journal.pbio.1000131)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global management effectiveness scores were applied equally to all regions.

name: Purchasing power parity as a proxy for subsistence fishing need, by region
description:
The per capita purchasing power parity (PPP) adjusted gross domestic product (GDP): GDPpcPPP.

Data sources:

- The World Bank [GDP per capita, PPP (current international $)](http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global purchasing power parity information was applied equally to all regions.

name: Trends in chemical pollution
description:
Modeled chemical pollution from commercial shipping traffic, ports and harbors, and pesticide use (Halpern et al. 2015).

Data sources:

- [FAOâs statistical database FAOSTAT](http://faostat3.fao.org/faostat-gateway/go/to/browse/R/*/E).
- Halpern, B. S. et al. (2015). **Spatial and temporal changes in cumulative human impacts on the world's ocean**. _Nature
Communications_ 6(7615). [doi: 10.1038/ncomms8615](http://www.nature.com/ncomms/2015/150714/ncomms8615/full/ncomms8615.html)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: Trends in fertilizer pollution as a proxy for nutrient pollution
description:
Modeled data based on fertilizer consumption from the Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO; Halpern et al. 2015). 

Data sources:

- [FAOâs statistical database FAOSTAT](http://faostat3.fao.org/faostat-gateway/go/to/browse/R/*/E)
- Halpern, B. S. et al. (2015). **Spatial and temporal changes in cumulative human impacts on the world's ocean**. _Nature
Communications_ 6(7615). [doi: 10.1038/ncomms8615](http://www.nature.com/ncomms/2015/150714/ncomms8615/full/ncomms8615.html)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: Trends in access to improved sanitation as a proxy for pathogen pollution trend
description:
Trends in percent of population without access to improved sanitation facilities.

Data sources:

- [World Health Organization and United Nations Children's Fund's Joint Monitoring Programme (WHO/UNICEF's JMP)](http://www.wssinfo.org/data-estimates/table)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: Trends in trash estimated using improperly disposed of plastics
description: Trend estimated using 2010 data and estimated 2025 data for improperly disposed of trash data.
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: status score for fis
description: Sb_sbmsy ratio weighted by annual mean catch

name: Trends in fis scores
description: trend in fis score

name: Fisheries weighting factor
description:
Proportion of wild caught fisheries yield to mariculture yield, based on FAO fisheries statistics.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-capture-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global weights were applied equally to all regions.

International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Red List threat categories with aggregated species lists

name: GDP
description:
Gross Domestic Product (GDP) data (reported in 2012 US dollars) from The World Bank.

- [The World Bank](data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.MKTP.CD)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global GDP data were applied to each region after weighting by each region's coastal population.

name: Jobs
description: gapfilled
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to each region.

name: Unemployment
description: gapfilled
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global unemployment percentages were applied equally to each region.

name: Wages
description: gapfilled
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global wages were applied equally to each region.

name: Modeled Livelihoods & Economies data
description: adjusted workforce size

name: Jobs weighting
description: Jobs weighting by sector (defaulting to 1)

name: Total population by subregion
description: Population data from The World Bank

name: Coastal protected areas inland 1km
description:
Coastal protected areas inland to 1km from the UN WDPA. 

Data sources:

- United Nations - World Conservation Monitoring Centreâs World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA) through [Protected Planet](http://www.protectedplanet.net)

name: Coastal marine protected areas offshore 3km
description:
Coastal protected areas offshore to 3nm from the UN WDPA. 

Data sources:

- United Nations - World Conservation Monitoring Centre's World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA) through [Protected Planet](http://www.protectedplanet.net)

name: Coastal population inland 25 miles
description:
Coastal population, defined as the total population inland of 25 miles, extracted from Gridded Population of the World (GPW) Population Density Grid Future Estimates.

Data sources:

- CIESIN & CIAT (Center for International Earth Science Information Network /Columbia University & Centro Internacional de Agricultura Tropical) (2005). **Gridded Population of the World, Version 3 (GPWv3): Population Density Grid, Future Estimates**. Palisades, NY. [NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC)](http://sedac.ciesin.columbia.edu/data/set/gpw-v3-population-density-future-estimates)

name: Mariculture harvest
description:
Mariculture harvest from the FAO.

- [FAO global aquaculture production](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-aquaculture-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global mariculture harvest (tonnes) data were applied to each region after weighting by each region's offshore area to 3nm.

name: Mariculture sustainability score
description:
Mariculture sustainability and mariculture regulations indicated by the Mariculture Sustainability Index (MSI). 

Data sources:

- Trujillo P. (2008). **Using a mariculture sustainability index to rank countriesâ performances**. In: A comparative assessment of biodiversity, fisheries and aquaculture in 53 countriesâ Exclusive Economic Zones, Alder J, Pauly D, editors. _Fisheries Centre Research Report_, vol. 16(7) p. 28â56.
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global mariculture sustainability scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Areas of observed blast (dynamite) fishing
description:
Destructive artisanal blast fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

Data sources:

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](http://www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Areas of observed poison fishing
description:
Destructive artisanal poison (cyanide) fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

Data sources:

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Product peak harvest in USD divided by sum of all product peak harvest values, per region
description:
Ratio of harvest USD of of six marine products (coral, fish oil, seaweed and plants, shells, sponges, ornamental fish) from FAO. Used to weight contribution of each product to final score.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-commodities-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global weights were applied equally to each region.

name: Harvest yield of marine natural products
description:
Yield in metric tonnes of six marine products (coral, fish oil, seaweed and plants, shells, sponges, ornamental fish) from FAO.  Used to calculate "exposure" component of natural products goal.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-commodities-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global harvest (tonnes) was applied to each region after weighting by each region's offshore area to 3nm.

name: Harvest ratio to peak yield of marine natural products
description:
Ratio to max yield (tonnes) of product peak for six marine products (coral, fish oil, seaweed and plants, shells, sponges, ornamental fish) from FAO.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-commodities-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Ocean acidification
description:
Change in current year's modeled aragonite saturation state (Feely et al. 2010) relative to historical mean (1880-1889).

Data sources:
- Feely, R., Doney, S. & Cooley, S. (2009) **Ocean acidification: present conditions and future changes in a high-CO2 world**.
_Oceanography_ 22:36-47. [doi:10.5670/oceanog.2009.95](http://www.tos.org/oceanography/archive/22-4_feely.html)
- J. Afflerbach et al. (2015). [Methods](https://github.com/OHI-Science/ohiprep/tree/master/globalprep/Pressures_OceanAcidification/v2015)

name: Sea level rise
description:
Modeled sea level rise (Nicholls and Cazenave 2010).

Data sources:

- Nicholls R.J. and Cazenave A. (2010). **Sea-level rise and its impact on coastal zones**. _Science_ 328: 1517-1520. [doi:10.1126/science.1185782](http://dx.doi.org/10.1126/science.1185782).
